bugs.title: CVE-2023-5367 tigervnc: xorg-x11-server: Out-of-bounds write in XIChangeDeviceProperty/RRChangeOutputProperty [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-5367 tigervnc: xorg-x11-server: Out-of-bounds write in XIChangeDeviceProperty/RRChangeOutputProperty [fedora-all]

long_desc.thetext:
An invalid offset calculation in the XIChangeDeviceProperty/RRChangeOutputProperty may result in an out-of-bounds memory write.

Reference:
https://lists.x.org/archives/xorg-announce/2023-October/003430.html

Created xorg-x11-server tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2246136]


Created xorg-x11-server-Xwayland tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2246137]

Created tigervnc tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2247468]

bugs.title: CVE-2023-5380 tigervnc: xorg-x11-server: Use-after-free bug in DestroyWindow [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-5380 tigervnc: xorg-x11-server: Use-after-free bug in DestroyWindow [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-5380 xorg-x11-server: Use-after-free bug in DestroyWindow

long_desc.thetext:
This vulnerability requires a legacy multi-screen setup with multiple protocol screens ("Zaphod"). If the pointer is warped from one screen to the root window of the other screen, the enter/leave code may retain a reference to the previous pointer window. Destroying this window leaves that reference in place, other windows may then trigger a use-after-free bug when they are destroyed.

This bug can be triggered only under very specific conditions, in particular it requires an XWarpPointer call and that the pointer never enters a client window on the other screen.

Reference:
https://lists.x.org/archives/xorg-announce/2023-October/003430.html

Created xorg-x11-server tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2246140]

Created tigervnc tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2247469]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2023:7428 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2023:7428

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2024:2169 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:2169
